description: From French rodomontade, a reference to Rodomonte, a boastful character in the Italian Renaissance epic poems Orlando innamorato (1483) and its sequel Orlando furioso (1506â€“1532). Doublet of rodomontado.

adjectives.description: rodomontade (comparative more rodomontade, superlative most rodomontade)

entries.meaning: Vain boasting; a rant; pretentious behaviour.

verbs.description: rodomontade (third-person singular simple present rodomontades, present participle rodomontading, simple past and past participle rodomontaded)

entries.meaning: (archaic) To boast, brag or bluster pretentiously.
